result.execSummary:
The defendant Shirtrell D Roby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, by 06-15-15.  
Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 
Non-mandatory fees waived due to financial instability.

Consecutive to: to any sentence.  
TIME SERVED disposition

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shirtrell D Roby

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shirtrell D Roby in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), a class U misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 DAY in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 1 days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all MANDATORY cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 6/15/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.   Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.  NON-MANDATORY fees are waived due to financial instability.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Shirtrell D Roby in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has tested negative, attended all apointments and is employed.  Review hearing scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Shirtrell D Roby in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant is testing positive.  Defendant will be attending group counseling.  Defendant needs to begin community service.  Review hearing scheduled for October 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Shirtrell D Roby in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.  Court approves the agreement.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and STAYS a judgment of conviction.  Review hearing scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shirtrell D Roby in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case may be resolved with a possible deferred prosecution agreement.  Defendant needs a TAD evaluation.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shirtrell D Roby in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Dennis Murphy for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shirtrell D Roby in court with attorney Caitlin H Firer.  Anthony E White appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
